album-cover-size-tooltip: Album cover size in pixels; set 0 to hide
app-drawer-columns-tooltip: Number of columns to show icons in
apply-tooltip: Apply changes, export includes, reload sway.
auto-show-hide-tooltip: Auto-hide dock, show on hotspot pointed.
autotiling-tooltip: Automates changing the horizontal/vertical window split orientation.
autotiling-depth-limit-tooltip: Depth limit determines how deep will autotiling work. The '2' value allows to mimic the master/stack layout on horizontal displays. On vertical displays you may like the '3' value. Use '0' for no limit. Beyond the limit, tabbed and stacking layouts will work back again. The '1' value is not recommended, as it will spoil autotiling.
autotiling-split-tooltip: Split width/height specifies the horizontal/vertical value multiplier to resize descendant containers to after splitting.
backup-desc: Back up configs and data files to a .tar.gz file
backup-invalid-file: is not a valid backup file.
backup-restore-desc: Restore configs and data files from a .tar.gz file
backup-restore-success:
Configs and data restored from backup.
Press the 'Apply' button to changes to take effect.
backup-restore-warning: Be careful, this action cannot be undone!
before-sleep-tooltip: Command to execute before systemd puts the computer to sleep.
calculate-lat-long-tooltip:
If you were online during the first run, the Lat/Long 
values should already reflect your timezone settings.
 Push the button if something went wrong
AND if you're online now.
capslock-tooltip: Initially enables or disables CapsLock on startup.
close-tooltip: Close the window w/o applying changes.
custom-field-name-tooltip:
User defined field that you need, but it's missing from the the form above.
Enter field name here. Think twice before you use it.
custom-field-value-tooltip:
User defined field that you need, but it's missing
from the the form above.
Enter field value here. Think twice before you use it.
device-tooltip:
Determines whether to use a certain device identifier
or just an input type.
disable-input-inhibitor-tooltip: Allows input events (like keyboard, mouse) on the lock screen.
dock-css-name-tooltip: Dock css style sheet file name
drawer-css-name-tooltip: Application drawer css style sheet file name
enable-mpris-widget-tooltip: Show MPRIS media player control widget
exclusive-zone-tooltip: Determines whether to move other windows away.
exit-menu-css-name-tooltip: Exit menu css style sheet file name
file-search-columns-tooltip: Number of columns to show file search result in
full-width-height-tooltip: Determines if to take full screen width/height.
hotspot-delay-tooltip:
Hotspot delay in milliseconds: the smaller, the faster the mouse
pointer needs to enter the hotspot for the dock to appear.
Set 0 to disable this feature (default 20).
interface-locale-tooltip:
Select a value to force one
or leave `auto` for auto-detection.
keep-resident-tooltip: Keep the program resident in memory.
keyboard-include-tooltip: Determines if to export the 'keyboard' config include.
keyboard-layout-tooltip:
Layout of the keyboard like 'us' or 'de'.
Multiple layouts can be specified
by separating them with commas.
keyboard-repeat-delay-tooltip: Amount of time a key must be held before it starts repeating.
keyboard-repeat-rate-tooltip: Frequency of key repeats once the repeat delay passed.
keyboard-tooltip:
Determines if the help window
should intercept the keyboard input.
keyboard-variant-tooltip: Variant of the keyboard like 'dvorak' or 'colemak'
leave-blank-to-use-above: Leave blank to use the above.
left-handed-tooltip: Enables or disables left handed mode.
lock-screen-include-tooltip: Determines if to add these settings to the 'autostart' include.
locker-tooltip: Program used to lock the screen.
locker-tooltip2: You may choose from `gtklock` and `swaylock`, if both installed.
logout-tooltip:
Command to logout the current user.
Leave blank to disable this feature.
margin-tooltip: Margin from the edge in pixels
middle-emulation-tooltip: Enables or disables middle click emulation
name: name
numlock-tooltip: Initially enables or disables NumLock on startup.
open-on-overlay-tooltip: Open on overlay layer (over panels etc.)
overlay-tooltip:
Determines if to display the help window
on the overlay layer, or as a regular window.
own-command-tooltip:
You may enter your own command here,
to replace the settings above.
panel-css-name-tooltip: Panel css style sheet file name
permanent-tooltip: Keeps the dock resident, but w/o the hotspot.
playerctl-tooltip: For this module to work, you need the `gtklock-powerbar-module` package.
pointer-device-include-tooltip: Determines if to export the 'pointer' config include.
power-off-tooltip:
Command to power off the computer.
Leave blank to disable this feature.
powerbar-tooltip: For this module to work, you need the `gtklock-powerbar-module` package.
reboot-tooltip:
Command to reboot the computer.
Leave blank to disable this feature.
restore-defaults-tooltip: Press to restore default idle settings.
scroll-factor-tooltip: Scroll speed will be scaled by the given value.
show-category-buttons-tooltip: Show freedesktop category buttons on top.
show-on-startup-tooltip: Uncheck to avoid running this window on startup
sleep-timeout-tooltip:
Sleep timeout in seconds.
Must be longer than Lock screen timeout.
suspend-tooltip:
Command to suspend the computer (put to sleep).
Leave blank to disable this feature.
switch-user-tooltip:
Command to switch the current user.
Leave blank to disable this feature.
tap-button-map-tooltip:
'lrm' treats 1 finger as left click, 2 fingers as right click, and 3 fingers as middle click.
'lmr' treats 1 finger as left click, 2 fingers as middle click, and 3 fingers as right click.
touchpad-device-include-tooltip: Determines if to export the 'touchpad' config include.
update-command-tooltip: You may override the default system update command here
update-indicator-interval-tooltip: Specifies how often (in minutes) to check for updates
update-tray-icon-tooltip: Determines if to show system updates tray icon
userinfo-tooltip:
For this module to work, you need to set the user info first. 
You may use the `mugshot` or `SwaySettings` package. 
You also need the `gtklock-userinfo-module` package.
web-browser-combo-tooltip:
Select from predefined commands
known for installed browsers.
web-browser-tooltip:
Command to run web browser
(probably w/ Wayland-specific arguments)
workspaces-tooltip: Defines which workspaces to use autotiling on: `autotiling -w`.
